messages.content: 我想要知道，如果正在感冒初期（非常轻微的症状），有什么方法能够减轻症状、更快恢复、让症状不要持续加重

If you're experiencing the early stages of a cold, here's what you can do to alleviate symptoms, promote faster recovery, and prevent the cold from worsening, according to current recommendations in 2025:

**General Recommendations:**

*   **Rest:** Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep. Sleep is your body's natural defense mechanism [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0), so prioritize it [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1). Avoid overexerting yourself to conserve energy [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Hydration:** Drink plenty of fluids like water, herbal teas, and broths [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Avoid alcohol and caffeinated drinks, which can be dehydrating [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Warm Liquids:** Sip warm liquids like chicken soup, tea, or warm apple juice to ease congestion by increasing mucus flow [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3].
*   **Honey:** Honey has antiviral and antibacterial properties that can thin mucus, relieve a sore throat, and ease coughing [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [yahoo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6]. Adding a spoonful of honey to warm tea may be beneficial [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). *Note: Honey should only be given to adults and children older than 1 year* [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [yahoo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6].
*   **Humidify the Air:** Use a cool-mist vaporizer or humidifier to add moisture to the air, which can ease stuffiness [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3] [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [yahoo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6]. If you don't have a humidifier, leave a shallow bowl of water near a heat source [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
*   **Avoid Cold and Damp Environments:** Stay warm and dry, as bacteria and viruses thrive in cooler temperatures [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0].

**Symptom Relief:**

*   **Over-the-Counter (OTC) Medications:** OTC medications can help relieve symptoms like cough, sneezing, runny nose, congestion, sore throat, headache, body aches, and fever [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4]. Options include decongestants, pain relievers (ibuprofen or acetaminophen), cough suppressants, and antihistamines [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4] [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4). *Children younger than 6 should not use OTC medications without consulting a doctor* [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4). *Aspirin should not be given to children under 18 due to the risk of Reye's Syndrome* [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Sore Throat:** Gargle with warm salt water [yahoo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5].
*   **Nasal Congestion:** Use saline nasal drops and rinses [yahoo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9]. A warm compress may relieve sinus pressure [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4].
*   **Cough:** Cough drops with menthol or honey can provide relief [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1).
*   **Zinc:** Taking zinc supplements within the first 24 hours of symptom onset *may* moderate cold symptoms and reduce the duration of a cold [goodrx](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). *However, a 2024 review suggests zinc supplements may have little or no effect on preventing colds* [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Vitamin C:** Taking vitamin C regularly *may* reduce the duration of colds and make them less severe [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7). The NIH notes that about 200 mg of vitamin C daily is needed to receive this benefit [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).

**Other Remedies:**

*   **Immune-Boosting Foods:** Eat healthy foods, especially dark green leafy vegetables [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).
*   **Honey and Lemon:** Combine honey (for antimicrobial properties) and lemon (for Vitamin C) in warm water [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Ginger:** Consume ginger to ease sore throats and reduce nasal congestion [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Spices:** Add turmeric, ginger, garlic, cinnamon, and clove to food for anti-inflammatory effects [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). A dash of cayenne pepper may help clear a stuffy nose [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).
*   **Echinacea:** Taking echinacea *may* slightly reduce your chance of developing a cold [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [goodrx](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).
*   **Probiotics:** Probiotic drinks *may* help relieve symptoms earlier [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Warm Compress:** Applying a warm compress to your face may relieve sinus pressure and pain [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).
*   **Aromatherapy:** Aromatherapy *may* provide some relief [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).

**Prevention:**

*   **Hygiene:** Wash your hands frequently with soap and water [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5] [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Avoid touching your face [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5] [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1).
*   **Avoid Contact:** Avoid close contact with people who have cold symptoms [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4] [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3].
*   **Cover Coughs and Sneezes:** Cover your nose and mouth with a tissue or your arm when coughing and sneezing [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4].
*   **Masks:** Wear a mask, especially if you have a weak immune system or spend time with people who do [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4].
*   **Strengthen Immune System:** Exercise regularly, maintain a healthy diet, and manage stress [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [ynhhs](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).

**Important Considerations:**

*   There is no cure for the common cold; the focus is on managing symptoms [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [ama-assn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-11) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4] [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   Most colds resolve on their own within 7-10 days [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   If symptoms don't improve after 24 hours or last more than 10 days, consult a doctor [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4] [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   If you suspect you may have COVID-19, consider taking an at-home test [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10).
*   Antibiotics are ineffective against colds, as they are caused by viruses [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10] [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   Consult a healthcare professional before starting any new medication or supplement [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0].

Remember that while some remedies like zinc, vitamin C, and echinacea *may* offer benefits, the evidence is mixed [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [ynhhs](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5). Focus on rest, hydration, and managing your symptoms to support your body's natural healing process [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).

search_query: best remedies early cold prevent worsening 2025
web_research_result:
Okay, I will conduct Google Searches to gather the most recent, credible information on "early cold treatment minimize symptoms 2025" and synthesize it into a verifiable text artifact.
Based on the search results, here's a summary of early cold treatments to minimize symptoms in 2025:

**General Recommendations:**

*   **Rest:** Getting 7-9 hours of quality sleep is crucial, as sleep is your body's natural defense mechanism [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Avoid over-exerting yourself to conserve energy for recovery [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **Hydration:** Drink plenty of fluids like water, herbal teas, and broths to thin mucus and relieve congestion [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Avoid alcohol and caffeinated drinks, which can be dehydrating [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   **Warm Liquids:** Sip warm liquids like chicken soup, tea, or warm apple juice to ease congestion by increasing mucus flow [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   **Honey:** Honey has antiviral and antibacterial properties that can thin mucus, relieve a sore throat, and ease coughing [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). Adding a spoonful of honey to warm tea may be beneficial [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). Honey may help coughs in adults and children older than 1 year [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   **Humidify the Air:** Use a cool-mist vaporizer or humidifier to add moisture to the air, which can ease stuffiness [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). If you don't have a humidifier, leave a shallow bowl of water near a heat source [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
*   **Avoid Cold and Damp Environments:** Stay warm and dry, as bacteria and viruses thrive in cooler temperatures [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

**Early Treatment Options:**

*   **Over-the-Counter (OTC) Medications:** OTC medications can help relieve symptoms like cough, sneezing, runny nose, congestion, sore throat, headache, body aches, and fever [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). Options include decongestants, pain relievers (ibuprofen or acetaminophen), cough suppressants, and antihistamines [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). Children younger than 6 should not use OTC medications without consulting a doctor [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
*   **Zinc:** Taking zinc supplements within the first 24 hours of symptom onset may moderate cold symptoms and reduce the duration of a cold [goodrx](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Zinc lozenges may inhibit viral replication in the nasal passages and throat [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). However, a 2024 review suggests zinc supplements may have little or no effect on preventing colds [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Vitamin C:** Taking vitamin C regularly may reduce the duration of colds and make them less severe [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7). The NIH notes that about 200 mg of vitamin C daily is needed to receive this benefit [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Saline Nasal Irrigation:** Use a saline nasal spray or rinse to clear nasal passages and flush out allergens and pathogens [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9). This can ease nasal congestion and potentially reduce the viral load in the nasal cavity [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   **Salt Water Gargle:** Gargling with warm salt water can help reduce throat pain, loosen mucus, and reduce throat inflammation [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [goodrx](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).

**Other Remedies:**

*   **Echinacea:** Taking echinacea may slightly reduce your chance of developing a cold [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [goodrx](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).
*   **Probiotics:** Probiotic drinks may help relieve symptoms earlier [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Warm Compress:** Applying a warm compress to your face may relieve sinus pressure and pain [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   **Aromatherapy:** Aromatherapy may provide some relief [benadryl](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).

**Prevention:**

*   **Hygiene:** Wash your hands frequently with soap and water [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). Avoid touching your face [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   **Avoid Contact:** Avoid close contact with people who have cold symptoms [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   **Cover Coughs and Sneezes:** Cover your nose and mouth with a tissue or your arm when coughing and sneezing [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   **Masks:** Wear a mask, especially if you have a weak immune system or spend time with people who do [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   **Vaccinations:** Stay up-to-date on recommended vaccines, like the flu and COVID-19 [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10).

**Important Considerations:**

*   There is no cure for the common cold; the focus is on managing symptoms [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [ama-assn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-11) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   Most colds resolve on their own within 7-10 days [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   If symptoms don't improve after 24 hours or last more than 10 days, consult a doctor [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   If you suspect you may have COVID-19, consider taking an at-home test [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10).
*   Antibiotics are ineffective against colds, as they are caused by viruses [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [massgeneralbrigham](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10).
*   Consult a healthcare professional before starting any new medication or supplement [elonhealthurgentcare](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

*   **Spices:** Add turmeric, ginger, garlic, cinnamon, and clove to food for anti-inflammatory effects [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). A dash of cayenne pepper may help clear a stuffy nose [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).

**Prevention:**

*   **Hygiene:** Wash hands frequently with soap and water [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Avoid touching your face [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1).
*   **Avoid Contact:** Limit close contact with people who have cold symptoms [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Strengthen Immune System:** Exercise regularly, maintain a healthy diet, and manage stress [jacksonhealth](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [kaiserpermanente](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [ynhhs](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   **Humidify:** Use a humidifier to add moisture to the air [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).

**Important Considerations:**

*   There is no cure for the common cold; remedies focus on symptom relief [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   Antibiotics are ineffective against colds, as they are caused by viruses [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   Consult a healthcare provider if symptoms worsen or last more than ten days [health](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   Children under 6 should not use over-the-counter medications without consulting a doctor [hopkinsmedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4). Aspirin should not be given to children under 18 due to the risk of Reye's Syndrome [doctorondemand](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).

While some studies suggest that zinc, vitamin C, and echinacea *may* help shorten the duration of a cold or reduce its severity, the evidence is mixed [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [healthline](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10) [clevelandclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7) [ynhhs](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8) [mayoclinic](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
